00057 
00058 static int fld_rrb_hash(struct lu_client_fld *fld, u64 seq)
00059 {
00060         LASSERT(fld->lcf_count > 0);
00061         return do_div(seq, fld->lcf_count);
00062 }
00063 
00064 static struct lu_fld_target *
00065 fld_rrb_scan(struct lu_client_fld *fld, u64 seq)
00066 {
00067         struct lu_fld_target *target;
00068         int hash;
00069         ENTRY;
00070 
00071         /* Because almost all of special sequence located in MDT0,
00072          * it should go to index 0 directly, instead of calculating
00073          * hash again, and also if other MDTs is not being connected,
00074          * the fld lookup requests(for seq on MDT0) should not be
00075          * blocked because of other MDTs */
00076         if (fid_seq_is_norm(seq))
00077                 hash = fld_rrb_hash(fld, seq);
00078         else
00079                 hash = 0;
00080 
00081 again:
00082         list_for_each_entry(target, &fld->lcf_targets, ft_chain) {
00083                 if (target->ft_idx == hash)
00084                         RETURN(target);
00085         }
00086 
00087         if (hash != 0) {
00088                 /* It is possible the remote target(MDT) are not connected to
00089                  * with client yet, so we will refer this to MDT0, which should
00090                  * be connected during mount */
00091                 hash = 0;
00092                 goto again;
00093         }
00094 
00095         CERROR("%s: Can't find target by hash %d (seq "LPX64"). "
00096                "Targets (%d):\n", fld->lcf_name, hash, seq,
00097                fld->lcf_count);
00098 
00099         list_for_each_entry(target, &fld->lcf_targets, ft_chain) {
00100                 const char *srv_name = target->ft_srv != NULL  ?
00101                         target->ft_srv->lsf_name : "<null>";
00102                 const char *exp_name = target->ft_exp != NULL ?
00103                         (char *)target->ft_exp->exp_obd->obd_uuid.uuid :
00104                         "<null>";
00105 
00106                 CERROR("  exp: 0x%p (%s), srv: 0x%p (%s), idx: "LPU64"\n",
00107                        target->ft_exp, exp_name, target->ft_srv,
00108                        srv_name, target->ft_idx);
00109         }
00110 
00111         /*
00112          * If target is not found, there is logical error anyway, so here is
00113          * LBUG() to catch this situation.
00114          */
00115         LBUG();
00116         RETURN(NULL);
00117 }
00118 
00119 struct lu_fld_hash fld_hash[] = {
00120         {
00121                 .fh_name = "RRB",
00122                 .fh_hash_func = fld_rrb_hash,
00123                 .fh_scan_func = fld_rrb_scan
00124         },
00125         {
00126                 NULL,
00127         }
00128 };
00129 
00130 static struct lu_fld_target *
00131 fld_client_get_target(struct lu_client_fld *fld, u64 seq)
00132 {
00133         struct lu_fld_target *target;
00134         ENTRY;
00135 
00136         LASSERT(fld->lcf_hash != NULL);
00137 
00138         spin_lock(&fld->lcf_lock);
00139         target = fld->lcf_hash->fh_scan_func(fld, seq);
00140         spin_unlock(&fld->lcf_lock);
00141 
00142         if (target != NULL) {
00143                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: Found target (idx "LPU64
00144                        ") by seq "LPX64"\n", fld->lcf_name,
00145                        target->ft_idx, seq);
00146         }
00147 
00148         RETURN(target);
00149 }
00150 
00151 /*
00152  * Add export to FLD. This is usually done by CMM and LMV as they are main users
00153  * of FLD module.
00154  */
00155 int fld_client_add_target(struct lu_client_fld *fld,
00156                           struct lu_fld_target *tar)
00157 {
00158         const char *name;
00159         struct lu_fld_target *target, *tmp;
00160         ENTRY;
00161 
00162         LASSERT(tar != NULL);
00163         name = fld_target_name(tar);
00164         LASSERT(name != NULL);
00165         LASSERT(tar->ft_srv != NULL || tar->ft_exp != NULL);
00166 
00167         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: Adding target %s (idx "LPU64")\n", fld->lcf_name,
00168                name, tar->ft_idx);
00169 
00170         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(target);
00171         if (target == NULL)
00172                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00173 
00174         spin_lock(&fld->lcf_lock);
00175         list_for_each_entry(tmp, &fld->lcf_targets, ft_chain) {
00176                 if (tmp->ft_idx == tar->ft_idx) {
00177                         spin_unlock(&fld->lcf_lock);
00178                         OBD_FREE_PTR(target);
00179                         CERROR("Target %s exists in FLD and known as %s:#"LPU64"\n",
00180                                name, fld_target_name(tmp), tmp->ft_idx);
00181                         RETURN(-EEXIST);
00182                 }
00183         }
00184 
00185         target->ft_exp = tar->ft_exp;
00186         if (target->ft_exp != NULL)
00187                 class_export_get(target->ft_exp);
00188         target->ft_srv = tar->ft_srv;
00189         target->ft_idx = tar->ft_idx;
00190 
00191         list_add_tail(&target->ft_chain, &fld->lcf_targets);
00192 
00193         fld->lcf_count++;
00194         spin_unlock(&fld->lcf_lock);
00195 
00196         RETURN(0);
00197 }
00198 EXPORT_SYMBOL(fld_client_add_target);
00199 
00200 /* Remove export from FLD */
00201 int fld_client_del_target(struct lu_client_fld *fld, __u64 idx)
00202 {
00203         struct lu_fld_target *target, *tmp;
00204         ENTRY;
00205 
00206         spin_lock(&fld->lcf_lock);
00207         list_for_each_entry_safe(target, tmp, &fld->lcf_targets, ft_chain) {
00208                 if (target->ft_idx == idx) {
00209                         fld->lcf_count--;
00210                         list_del(&target->ft_chain);
00211                         spin_unlock(&fld->lcf_lock);
00212 
00213                         if (target->ft_exp != NULL)
00214                                 class_export_put(target->ft_exp);
00215 
00216                         OBD_FREE_PTR(target);
00217                         RETURN(0);
00218                 }
00219         }
00220         spin_unlock(&fld->lcf_lock);
00221         RETURN(-ENOENT);
00222 }
00223 
00224 #ifdef CONFIG_PROC_FS
00225 static int fld_client_proc_init(struct lu_client_fld *fld)
00226 {
00227         int rc;
00228         ENTRY;
00229 
00230         fld->lcf_proc_dir = lprocfs_register(fld->lcf_name, fld_type_proc_dir,
00231                                              NULL, NULL);
00232         if (IS_ERR(fld->lcf_proc_dir)) {
00233                 CERROR("%s: LProcFS failed in fld-init\n",
00234                        fld->lcf_name);
00235                 rc = PTR_ERR(fld->lcf_proc_dir);
00236                 RETURN(rc);
00237         }
00238 
00239         rc = lprocfs_add_vars(fld->lcf_proc_dir, fld_client_proc_list, fld);
00240         if (rc) {
00241                 CERROR("%s: Can't init FLD proc, rc %d\n",
00242                        fld->lcf_name, rc);
00243                 GOTO(out_cleanup, rc);
00244         }
00245 
00246         RETURN(0);
00247 
00248 out_cleanup:
00249         fld_client_proc_fini(fld);
00250         return rc;
00251 }
00252 
00253 void fld_client_proc_fini(struct lu_client_fld *fld)
00254 {
00255         ENTRY;
00256         if (fld->lcf_proc_dir) {
00257                 if (!IS_ERR(fld->lcf_proc_dir))
00258                         lprocfs_remove(&fld->lcf_proc_dir);
00259                 fld->lcf_proc_dir = NULL;
00260         }
00261         EXIT;
00262 }
00263 #else /* !CONFIG_PROC_FS */
00264 static int fld_client_proc_init(struct lu_client_fld *fld)
00265 {
00266         return 0;
00267 }
00268 
00269 void fld_client_proc_fini(struct lu_client_fld *fld)
00270 {
00271         return;
00272 }
00273 #endif /* CONFIG_PROC_FS */
00274 
00275 EXPORT_SYMBOL(fld_client_proc_fini);
00276 
00277 static inline int hash_is_sane(int hash)
00278 {
00279         return (hash >= 0 && hash < ARRAY_SIZE(fld_hash));
00280 }
00281 
00282 int fld_client_init(struct lu_client_fld *fld,
00283                     const char *prefix, int hash)
00284 {
00285         int cache_size, cache_threshold;
00286         int rc;
00287         ENTRY;
00288 
00289         LASSERT(fld != NULL);
00290 
00291         snprintf(fld->lcf_name, sizeof(fld->lcf_name),
00292                  "cli-%s", prefix);
00293 
00294         if (!hash_is_sane(hash)) {
00295                 CERROR("%s: Wrong hash function %#x\n",
00296                        fld->lcf_name, hash);
00297                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00298         }
00299 
00300         fld->lcf_count = 0;
00301         spin_lock_init(&fld->lcf_lock);
00302         fld->lcf_hash = &fld_hash[hash];
00303         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&fld->lcf_targets);
00304 
00305         cache_size = FLD_CLIENT_CACHE_SIZE /
00306                 sizeof(struct fld_cache_entry);
00307 
00308         cache_threshold = cache_size *
00309                 FLD_CLIENT_CACHE_THRESHOLD / 100;
00310 
00311         fld->lcf_cache = fld_cache_init(fld->lcf_name,
00312                                         cache_size, cache_threshold);
00313         if (IS_ERR(fld->lcf_cache)) {
00314                 rc = PTR_ERR(fld->lcf_cache);
00315                 fld->lcf_cache = NULL;
00316                 GOTO(out, rc);
00317         }
00318 
00319         rc = fld_client_proc_init(fld);
00320         if (rc)
00321                 GOTO(out, rc);
00322         EXIT;
00323 out:
00324         if (rc)
00325                 fld_client_fini(fld);
00326         else
00327                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: Using \"%s\" hash\n",
00328                        fld->lcf_name, fld->lcf_hash->fh_name);
00329         return rc;
00330 }
00331 EXPORT_SYMBOL(fld_client_init);
00332 
00333 void fld_client_fini(struct lu_client_fld *fld)
00334 {
00335         struct lu_fld_target *target, *tmp;
00336         ENTRY;
00337 
00338         spin_lock(&fld->lcf_lock);
00339         list_for_each_entry_safe(target, tmp, &fld->lcf_targets, ft_chain) {
00340                 fld->lcf_count--;
00341                 list_del(&target->ft_chain);
00342                 if (target->ft_exp != NULL)
00343                         class_export_put(target->ft_exp);
00344                 OBD_FREE_PTR(target);
00345         }
00346         spin_unlock(&fld->lcf_lock);
00347 
00348         if (fld->lcf_cache != NULL) {
00349                 if (!IS_ERR(fld->lcf_cache))
00350                         fld_cache_fini(fld->lcf_cache);
00351                 fld->lcf_cache = NULL;
00352         }
00353 
00354         EXIT;
00355 }
00356 EXPORT_SYMBOL(fld_client_fini);
00357 
00358 int fld_client_rpc(struct obd_export *exp,
00359                    struct lu_seq_range *range, __u32 fld_op,
00360                    struct ptlrpc_request **reqp)
00361 {
00362         struct ptlrpc_request *req = NULL;
00363         struct lu_seq_range   *prange;
00364         __u32                 *op;
00365         int                    rc = 0;
00366         struct obd_import     *imp;
00367         ENTRY;
00368 
00369         LASSERT(exp != NULL);
00370 
00371 again:
00372         imp = class_exp2cliimp(exp);
00373         switch (fld_op) {
00374         case FLD_QUERY:
00375                 req = ptlrpc_request_alloc_pack(imp, &RQF_FLD_QUERY,
00376                                                 LUSTRE_MDS_VERSION, FLD_QUERY);
00377                 if (req == NULL)
00378                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00379 
00380                 /* XXX: only needed when talking to old server(< 2.6), it should
00381                  * be removed when < 2.6 server is not supported */
00382                 op = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_FLD_OPC);
00383                 *op = FLD_LOOKUP;
00384 
00385                 /* For MDS_MDS seq lookup, it will always use LWP connection,
00386                  * but LWP will be evicted after restart, so cause the error.
00387                  * so we will set no_delay for seq lookup request, once the
00388                  * request fails because of the eviction. always retry here */
00389                 if (imp->imp_connect_flags_orig & OBD_CONNECT_MDS_MDS) {
00390                         req->rq_allow_replay = 1;
00391                         req->rq_no_delay = 1;
00392                 }
00393                 break;
00394         case FLD_READ:
00395                 req = ptlrpc_request_alloc_pack(imp, &RQF_FLD_READ,
00396                                                 LUSTRE_MDS_VERSION, FLD_READ);
00397                 if (req == NULL)
00398                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00399 
00400                 req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_GENERIC_DATA,
00401                                      RCL_SERVER, PAGE_CACHE_SIZE);
00402                 break;
00403         default:
00404                 rc = -EINVAL;
00405                 break;
00406         }
00407 
00408         if (rc != 0)
00409                 RETURN(rc);
00410 
00411         prange = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_FLD_MDFLD);
00412         *prange = *range;
00413         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
00414         req->rq_request_portal = FLD_REQUEST_PORTAL;
00415         req->rq_reply_portal = MDC_REPLY_PORTAL;
00416         ptlrpc_at_set_req_timeout(req);
00417 
00418         obd_get_request_slot(&exp->exp_obd->u.cli);
00419         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
00420         obd_put_request_slot(&exp->exp_obd->u.cli);
00421 
00422         if (rc == -ENOENT) {
00423                 /* Don't loop forever on non-existing FID sequences. */
00424                 GOTO(out_req, rc);
00425         }
00426 
00427         if (rc != 0) {
00428                 if (imp->imp_state != LUSTRE_IMP_CLOSED &&
00429                     !imp->imp_deactive &&
00430                     imp->imp_connect_flags_orig & OBD_CONNECT_MDS_MDS &&
00431                     rc != -ENOTSUPP) {
00432                         /* Since LWP is not replayable, so it will keep
00433                          * trying unless umount happens or the remote
00434                          * target does not support the operation, otherwise
00435                          * it would cause unecessary failure of the
00436                          * application. */
00437                         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00438                         rc = 0;
00439                         goto again;
00440                 }
00441                 GOTO(out_req, rc);
00442         }
00443 
00444         if (fld_op == FLD_QUERY) {
00445                 prange = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill,
00446                                                 &RMF_FLD_MDFLD);
00447                 if (prange == NULL)
00448                         GOTO(out_req, rc = -EFAULT);
00449                 *range = *prange;
00450         }
00451 
00452         EXIT;
00453 out_req:
00454         if (rc != 0 || reqp == NULL) {
00455                 ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00456                 req = NULL;
00457         }
00458 
00459         if (reqp != NULL)
00460                 *reqp = req;
00461 
00462         return rc;
00463 }
00464 
00465 int fld_client_lookup(struct lu_client_fld *fld, u64 seq, u32 *mds,
00466                       __u32 flags, const struct lu_env *env)
00467 {
00468         struct lu_seq_range res = { 0 };
00469         struct lu_fld_target *target;
00470         struct lu_fld_target *origin;
00471         int rc;
00472         ENTRY;
00473 
00474         rc = fld_cache_lookup(fld->lcf_cache, seq, &res);
00475         if (rc == 0) {
00476                 *mds = res.lsr_index;
00477                 RETURN(0);
00478         }
00479 
00480         /* Can not find it in the cache */
00481         target = fld_client_get_target(fld, seq);
00482         LASSERT(target != NULL);
00483         origin = target;
00484 again:
00485         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: Lookup fld entry (seq: "LPX64") on "
00486                "target %s (idx "LPU64")\n", fld->lcf_name, seq,
00487                fld_target_name(target), target->ft_idx);
00488 
00489         res.lsr_start = seq;
00490         fld_range_set_type(&res, flags);
00491 
00492 #ifdef HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT
00493         if (target->ft_srv != NULL) {
00494                 LASSERT(env != NULL);
00495                 rc = fld_server_lookup(env, target->ft_srv, seq, &res);
00496         } else
00497 #endif /* HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT */
00498         {
00499                 rc = fld_client_rpc(target->ft_exp, &res, FLD_QUERY, NULL);
00500         }
00501 
00502         if (rc == -ESHUTDOWN) {
00503                 /* If fld lookup failed because the target has been shutdown,
00504                  * then try next target in the list, until trying all targets
00505                  * or fld lookup succeeds */
00506                 spin_lock(&fld->lcf_lock);
00507 
00508                 /* If the next entry in the list is the head of the list,
00509                  * move to the next entry after the head and retrieve
00510                  * the target. Else retreive the next target entry. */
00511 
00512                 if (target->ft_chain.next == &fld->lcf_targets)
00513                         target = list_entry(target->ft_chain.next->next,
00514                                             struct lu_fld_target, ft_chain);
00515                 else
00516                         target = list_entry(target->ft_chain.next,
00517                                                  struct lu_fld_target,
00518                                                  ft_chain);
00519                 spin_unlock(&fld->lcf_lock);
00520                 if (target != origin)
00521                         goto again;
00522         }
00523         if (rc == 0) {
00524                 *mds = res.lsr_index;
00525                 fld_cache_insert(fld->lcf_cache, &res);
00526         }
00527 
00528         RETURN(rc);
00529 }
00530 EXPORT_SYMBOL(fld_client_lookup);
00531 
00532 void fld_client_flush(struct lu_client_fld *fld)
00533 {
00534         fld_cache_flush(fld->lcf_cache);
00535 }
00536 
00537 
00538 struct proc_dir_entry *fld_type_proc_dir;
00539 
00540 static int __init fld_init(void)
00541 {
00542         fld_type_proc_dir = lprocfs_register(LUSTRE_FLD_NAME,
00543                                              proc_lustre_root,
00544                                              NULL, NULL);
00545         if (IS_ERR(fld_type_proc_dir))
00546                 return PTR_ERR(fld_type_proc_dir);
00547 
00548 #ifdef HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT
00549         fld_server_mod_init();
00550 #endif /* HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT */
00551 
00552         return 0;
00553 }
00554 
00555 static void __exit fld_exit(void)
00556 {
00557 #ifdef HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT
00558         fld_server_mod_exit();
00559 #endif /* HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT */
00560 
00561         if (fld_type_proc_dir != NULL && !IS_ERR(fld_type_proc_dir)) {
00562                 lprocfs_remove(&fld_type_proc_dir);
00563                 fld_type_proc_dir = NULL;
00564         }
00565 }

00569 MODULE_VERSION(LUSTRE_VERSION_STRING);

00572 module_init(fld_init);
00573 module_exit(fld_exit);
